intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: All right, Corrin. Let’s go in there together. I’ll help as much as possible. This is our father we’re talking about. He has to forgive you, right?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thanks, Elise. I hope you’re right.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: All right. Deep breath, and… here we go. Father! We have something we need to talk you about!

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Gah hah ha!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Father?

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: It sound like he’s with someone… Maybe we should come back later.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Hrmph! Who’s there?

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Oh! Sorry to bother you, Father…

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Yes, we apologize if this isn’t a good time.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: What do you two want?

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Father, we’re here to apologize. Right, Corrin?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Yes, that’s right. I’m sorry for questioning you.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: You may enter.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Corrin… You disobeyed a direct order from me. Ordinarily you would not still be alive.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I understand…

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: No! Father, I can explain-

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Silence! As you are my child, Corrin, I will grant you some leeway. I have something in mind for you. A mission. If you complete this task successfully, I will pardon your crime in full.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Really?! What sort of mission?

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: There is an abandoned fortress perched on the Hoshidan border. I wish to know if the building there remains serviceable. You are to travel to the site and inspect the premises. No battle will be required. Do you understand? I won’t tolerate being disappointed twice…

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Yes, Father. It shall be done.

intro.speaker: Camilla
intro.line: Darling, are you sure you’re going to be OK out there? I don’t like this…

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Of course! Please don’t worry. It’s just an abandoned fort.

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: You’re acting rather casual about all this, Corrin. It isn’t like Father to be so forgiving…

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Huh? What do you mean, Leo?

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: That’s enough, Leo! Don’t be so worried all the time, sheesh. And don’t even try to scare Corrin before his/her first mission!

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: Hey! That’s not necessary.

intro.speaker: Camilla
intro.line: I suppose I’ll just have to come along. That way I know Corrin will be safe.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: I’m afraid that’s not possible.

intro.speaker: Camilla
intro.line: Why ever not, Iago?

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Lady Camilla, King Garon intends his expedition as a test of sorts. As his top advisor, I have been entrusted with coordinating this mission. He would like to know whether Prince/Princess Corrin is worthy… After all, he/she IS a part of the royal lineage. Therefore, your assistance would simply muddy the results.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Understood. Camilla, I need to do this all by myself. Surely you understand.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Not all by yourself, Corrin.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Father! I didn’t see you there.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Rest assured, I don’t intend to send you out there completely defenseless.

intro.speaker: Hans
intro.line: …Milord/Milady.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: This is Hans. He is a veteran warrior and will ensure no trouble befalls you.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you, Father.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Hmm…

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: I’d be wary of that man if I were you, Corrin…

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Why do you say that?

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: He’s a criminal. A murderer and scoundrel. I arrested him myself, years ago. Father seems to think he’s rehabilitated, but I’m not so sure. That said, he is a formidable soldier.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I see.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Wow… Is this it? The Bottomless Canyon?

intro.speaker: Gunter
intro.line: Yes. It’s the natural boundary dividing Nohr and Hoshido.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: It can’t be really bottomless, can it?

intro.speaker: Gunter
intro.line: Let the eternal darkness below be your answer. Those who fall in never return… I truly despise this place. Something about the land around here just isn’t right. The sky here is always dark and foreboding, and lightning strikes all who fly across. This clearly a place us mortals were never meant to enter. Normally we’d go around… But the fort that King Garon wants surveyed is right over there.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Oh, it’s not so bad. Or perhaps I’m just happy to be outside in the fresh air! Compared to the inside of that fortress, this is downright exiting.

intro.speaker: Gunter
intro.line: Ha! That certainly puts things in perspective, milord/milady. Come, let’s proceed.

intro.speaker: Gunter
intro.line: Blast! It looks like this fort isn’t as abandoned as we thought. Why the devil is this place crawling with Hoshidans?

intro.speaker: Hoshidan
intro.line: Hold on! Do not advance any farther, soliders of Nohr.

intro.speaker: Omozu
intro.line: Crossing that bridge is a violation of our border treaty. Turn back at once, or we’ll be forced to attack!

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: What should we do?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: We’re not here to fight. I suppose we’ll have to turn back and report to Father.

intro.speaker: Gunter
intro.line: Wise decision, Lord/Lady Corrin.

intro.speaker: Hans
intro.line: Who asked you, old man?

intro.speaker: Gunter
intro.line: What?!

intro.speaker: Hans
intro.line: Gyaaah!

intro.speaker: Hoshidan
intro.line: AAAUGH!

intro.speaker: Hans
intro.line: Ah ha ha! Die, scumbags!

intro.speaker: Omozu
intro.line: You’ll pay for this!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Hans, what are you doing?! We had no reason to engage these troops!

intro.speaker: Hans
intro.line: Pfft.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: We should have tried diplomacy first. We weren’t sent here to fight!

intro.speaker: Hans
intro.line: Speak for yourself, weakling.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What’s that supposed to mean?

intro.speaker: Omozu
intro.line: Soldiers of Hoshido, hear me! Do not leave a single Nohrian alive!

intro.speaker: Hoshidan
intro.line: Prepare to attack!

intro.speaker: Gunter
intro.line: Argh! Looks like there’s no getting out of this now. Get ready to fight, Lord/Lady Corrin.

battle.speaker: Gunter
battle.line: Now then, Lord/Lady Corrin. There are two kinds of battle formations. You’ll need to learn both, and fast! You can take a defensive position by moving to the same space as an ally. Your ally will benefit from your support, but you won’t be able to attack. If you want to unleash the most potent attacks, stand in adjacent positions. From that alignment, allies may be able to attack simultaneously. I’d tell you more, but you’re about to receive some practical experience…

battle.speaker: Gunter
battle.line: I’m afraid the enemy’s position across that bridge may be impenetrable. We’ve got to look for another way across. Lord/Lady Corrin! See if you can find a Dragon Vein around here.

battle.speaker: Omozu
battle.line: Gods! Did you see what just happened to the cliff? Who are we dealing with here?

battle.speaker: Felicia
battle.line: Look! More troops are arriving from the south!

battle.speaker: Gunter
battle.line: More enemy reinforcements… Take caution, Lord/Lady Corrin.

boss.speaker: Hans
boss.line: Bwahaha! Look like I’ve done enough damage for the time being. Time to lay low and see how this all plays out…

boss.speaker: Omozu
boss.line: Do you even realize what you’ve done here today? Hoshido won’t stand for unprovoked attacks like this. Revenge will be ours!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: This isn’t what I had in mind…but at least I’ve completed Father’s mission.

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: You’re the leader of these troops? Pah. You’re nothing more than a boy/girl.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Who are you?

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: My name is Saizo. I’ve come to claim your life.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Hey! Everyone! We’re still under attack!

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: Destroy them!
I won’t allow it!

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: What?! This must be their real commander…

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: What’s going on here, Corrin?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Xander! How did you know were in trouble?

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: We’ve arrived just in time. Your luck never runs out, does it, Brother/Sister?

end.speaker: Camilla
end.line: Are you all right? I was so worried about you.

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: We’re all here for you, Corrin!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Thank you, everyone! Um, but before we get too carried away… we ARE under attack.

end.speaker: Camilla
end.line: Who dares attack my beloved Corrin? I’ll have their heads on a platter!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I’m not hurt, Camilla.

end.speaker: Camilla
end.line: But, darling…it’s the thought that counts!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I never knew Camilla could be so…ruthless…

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: Heehee! That’s right, you’ve never seen her on the battlefield before.

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: This is not going well…

end.speaker: Kagero
end.line: Saizo! What’s wrong? What’s our status?

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: I misjudged the situation. We’re outnumbered. Kagero, do we have anyone else on the way?

end.speaker: Kagero
end.line: Affirmative. Lord Ryoma is right behind me.

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: Ahh… Then I think this battle is as good as won.

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: It looks like more Hoshidan reinforcements are on the way.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Indeed… What should we do?

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: Well, Corrin is safe, and the fort’s condition has been evaluated. There’s no reason to engage Hoshido further at this point. Corrin, you take the lead with Gunter. We’ll follow close behind.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Will do. Thank you, Xander.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Gunter, have you seen Felicia/Jakob? She/He was here a second ago…

end.speaker: Gunter
end.line: I’m sure she’s/he's right behind us. Now hurry up. I can’t stand being on this bridge a moment longer.

end.speaker: Hans
end.line: Don’t worry-you won’t have to stand there much longer.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Hans!

end.speaker: Gunter
end.line: What is the meaning of this?

end.speaker: Hans
end.line: Less talk. More death.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Hans, no! Why are you doing this? Your own ally…

end.speaker: Hans
end.line: Aww, did I knock your babysitter into the ditch? Here- you can meet up with him at the bottom!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: You’ll pay for this!

end.speaker: Hans
end.line: What?! What kind of…freak…are you?

end.speaker: Hans
end.line: It can’t be..

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I want answers, Hans! Why are you doing this? Why did you provoke the Hoshians? And why did you kill Gunter? Answer me!

end.speaker: Hans
end.line: Just following orders. King Garon’s orders.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: What?! You lie!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Come back here!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Huh? Noooo!

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: My kin, my gods, my blood… Dragons grant me strength! Great Moro, I beseech you!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Lilith? Is that you? What…ARE you?

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: Lord/Lady Corrin… I knew this day would come eventually. This may come as a shock, but I am not a human.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Well, I can see that. Are you a dragon?

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: Yes, this is my true form. You’ve seen it before. Do you remember? That strange bird you rescued in the barn…

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: That… was you…?

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: It was. Once I recovered, I was able to take human form. You were so kind to me that I decided to remain a human that I might serve you. But now I have used a power that goes beyond the capacity of a human body. I will not be able to return to that form. I don’t mind, though. The most important thing to me is that you’re safe…

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: Eeek!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Lilith! Be careful! Drop me if you must… I won’t have you sacrifice yourself for me!

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: First Dragons, I call on you. Grant us access to the astral plane!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: What just happened?! Where…are we?

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: This is a world parallel to the one in which you live, Lord/Lady Corrin. It is known as the astral plane.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: How were you able to get us here?

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: The First Dragons have granted us the power to inhabit this dimension. Under their protection, we are safe here. Oh! Allow me to prepare a place for you to rest…

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Did… did you just use a Dragon Vein?

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: Yes. The power of the First Dragons flows freely in this realm. You should know that space and time operate differently here as well…

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I have so much to learn… Is there anyone else here?

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: No, we are alone. There’s no one left here…

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to invoke any bad memories.

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: It’s OK, Corrin. I’m not lonely as long as I have you in my life. Now…you should get some rest.

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: How are you feeling, Corrin? I know this is a lot to take in.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes, it is. But I feel much better now. My wounds seem to have healed already. And my mind is racing! I have so many new questions about this world…

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: All in good time. For now, some business remains in the other world.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes, you’re right. I can’t relax until I know everyone made it safely home.

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: Of course. There is just one thing you should know before you go back. When I open the portal, you will return to the same location you came from. That means you’ll arrive right on the Hoshidan border. There may be soldiers lying in wait for you…

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I understand. I’ll be ready for them.

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: Very well. Then I will open the gate.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Ah, I’m back. But… where is everyone?
You’re mine, Nohrian!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Hmm?!
